messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?

Communications, Mrs. Graham? This is Allison Ward, the principal at Snipes Academy. We have a dead body right out in front of our school on the grass area, but we're at the Dorothy B. Johnson location.
What is the address, ma'am?
1100 McCray Street.
1100 McCray, and it's a person out there?
Yes, my custodian found a young man. His body is stiff.
And are you sure he's deceased?
Yes, he kicked him, and he's stiff. He didn't move. He appears to be in rigor. There's blood coming out of his nose. I mean, I'm not going to touch him, but I'd say he's definitely dead.
That's okay. How old does he appear to be?
He looks like he's probably between 18 to 22. We're right down from the Wilmington Police Department, but we don't have a school resource officer.
And you're at 1100 McCray?
Yes, ma'am, and I'm the principal here.
Okay, just stay on the phone for one minute, okay?
Yes, ma'am, not a problem.
Let me go ahead and get some help started over there.
Okay. We're going to need the medical examiner or whatever, I guess.
Is he a black or white male? Can you tell?
He's an African American male. We're covering the body so that if we have kids come.
Hang on a second. Let's make sure you're allowed to touch him. And he has blood coming from where?
He's coming out of his right nostril, that kind of ran down his nose.
Okay, yeah, don't touch him.
So can we step in? I don't know how we're going to...
And you say he's stiff?
Yes, ma'am. He's definitely stiff.
We're trying to figure out how to keep kids from coming on campus until we can at least get this scene secured so they're not looking at this.
Okay, and I can tell you how to do CPR, do you think it's...
No, ma'am, he's definitely beyond CPR, and we have several of us standing here trained first responders, but he is not.
Okay. Holy cow. Did anybody see what happened?
No, ma'am, we just... I came in the dark this morning. I was here at 5:15, 5:20, and I didn't see anything.
My head custodian came at about six or so, and my assistant principal just drove in, and she said there's somebody sleeping out in front of the school.
We have to wait until they come to the scene. It looks like something came out of the nose.
We may need help stopping buses and parent traffic; I don't think we should let kids or anybody on here until we have this cordoned off.
You have an SRO on site?
Not at the moment. Maybe we can get to lock cars, but we've got to get the paramedics in here first.
Okay, I'll notify the SROs and maybe they can get over there to help you out.
That would be great. Deputy McMillan is at Virgo and Deputy Curry is ours, and I know Sergeant Sears is here quite frequently.
And you're at Snipes Academy, right?
That's the name of the school but we're at the Dorothy B. Johnson site.
Okay, but it's 1100 McCray Street?
Yes, ma'am.
Okay, I have everybody on the way over there. I'm going to go ahead and let you go. Just keep everybody away from him, away from the area as much as possible.
Okay.
They need to investigate the surrounding area, just don't let anybody keep going up to them and walking around that area.
Okay, great.
They should be there shortly.
Thank you.
If anything changes before they get there, just call us back.
Yes, ma'am. Thank you.
